title: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID - kopie 1

items.content:
Have you ever done something which seemed really cool but ended up REALLY embarrassing? Well, you're not alone...

Watch this video and guess what the words 'Epic' and 'Fail' mean.

The story we are going to see and read is about an American schoolboy of about 11 years old. Let's find out more about school in America. Check what you already know and find out more....

See if you can answer the questions:

  1. At what age do children go to school in America?
  2. Which different kinds of school do you know in America?
  3. What kind of classes do American children have at school?
  4. How do children in America generally get to school?
  5. Do they eat at school? if so, what do they eat?
  6. Can you think of some typical American school customs or traditions?
  7. What kind of sports are played at school?
  8. What else do you know about schools in America?

Make a Mindmap on worksheet 2A or use bubbl.us. See how many questions you can answer without any research:

  1. At what age do children go to school in America?
  2. Which different kinds of school do you know in America?
  3. What kind of classes do American children have at school?
  4. How do children in America generally get to school?
  5. Do they eat at school? if so, what do they eat?
  6. Can you think of some typical American school customs or traditions?
  7. What kind of sports are played at school?
  8. What else do you know about schools in America?

Discuss your mindmap in pairs. Did you manage to answer all questions? What else did you remember about schools in America?

Your teacher will form groups. Your group will get some of the questions of assignment 2A. Search the internet to find the answers. Discuss what you've found on the internet in your group.

Now make a poster, Powerpoint or Prezi that shows what you know about American schools. Use the internet to look up photos, cartoons, pictures, graphs and more.

Next lesson you are going to present your poster, powerpoint or prezi to the rest of the class in English. Check out the RUBRIC to see how you will be marked. Remember the feedback you received for your presentation about the Body & Health Magazine: Try to improve yourself, show what you have learned!

Before we actually start reading, we are going to watch a part of the movie... after watching you will answer some questions.

Now in pairs, describe to each other, in English, what the book we are going to read will be about.

First your teacher will read the beginning of the story to you. Read along and pay attention to pronunciation. Every few pages we will check what we've read.

Check out the WORKSHEET to help you summarize.

Now you are going to read the entire book together. We will see how it ends....

Your teacher will divide the class in groups of 3 or 4 students. Each group will prepare a presentation about 3/4 chapters. Together, you will read the chapters and summarize them.

In your group, decide how you will read the chapters:

  • Split up the chapters: each reads his own chapter.
  • Read all chapters for yourselves.
  • Read all three chapters together: at turns read to the others while they read along.

Again, use the WORKSHEET to help you summarize. After reading, every groupmember has to be able to retell the story all by himself to a new group. You can use your summary worksheet for this.

Did you finish reading? Discuss the main points in each chapter. Use the summary sheet you have filled in. Answer the questions together:

  • What happened?
  • Where did it take place?
  • Who was there?
  • Why did it happen?
  • How did it happen?

Make sure you know the details of the chapters you had to read. Try retelling the story to one another to practice. Later on you will have to retell the story on your own to students who haven't read these chapters!

Now discuss in your group how you feel about what you have read:

  • Was it hard or easy to read? Why?
  • Did you like what you read? Why (not)?
  • How do you feel about what happens in the book?
  • Can you identify yourself with the characters? Why (not)?
  • Have you learned anything new from the book? What is that?
  • How do you think the story continues/ends?

After discussing this in your group, you will make your own cartoon about a situation in the book. Use Worksheet Comic Writing and have a look at the RUBRIC to see how you will be marked.

https://www.pixton.com/

Remember the Epic or Fail video from the Ellen Degeneres Show? Some of the things that happen in the book could be shown as Epic or Fail moments!

Think back to the chapters of the book you have read. Is there a part that is "Epic" or maybe "Fail"? You are going to write your own filmscript and act it out in a group.

Make a video of this Epic or Fail moment from the book and hand it in by ELO. Have a good look at the RUBRIC before you start. It tells you how this assignment will be marked.

We are now going to watch the end of the movie. After watching you will fill in the WORKSHEET alone.

Then we will discuss in groups.

You've seen parts of the movie and read parts of the book. Now it is time to write: you can choose between a few different assignments:

1. Write a review about the book.

2. Write a letter to the mail character.
Explain him the "Do's and Don'ts" in Middle School.

3. Write a manual for children that go to middle school:
"How to survive Middle School".

4. Write another ending of the story.

5. Write what you would have done if you were Greg.

Choose one of the assignments above. Click on the WORKSHEET for more information.

Hand in the assignment in ELO. (writing assignment Diary of a Whimpy Kid) (opdracht aanmaken in de elo)

Ayoub always plays soccer on Wednesday. Ayoub is playing soccer right now.

Bob always drinks coffee at school. Look, Bob is drinking coffee over there!

I am a student at CSV. I am studying English at the moment.

Do you see the difference between the sentences above? In this period you learn more about the Present Simple & Present Continuous and how to use them correctly.

First, you are going to do a small test to see how much you already know. Show your teacher your results and make a screenshot of your scores.

In order to write and talk correctly, you need to know the correct wordorder in English. Down below you will find links to instructive websites and youtube clips, explaining the correct wordorder and practice some more.

First, you are going to do diagnostic test to see what you already know and are able to do. Show the results of this test to your teacher to help you decide what to do next:

To talk about things in the past, you need to know about the Past Simple and Present Perfect and how to use them. Last year you learned how to use the Past Simple, but you might want to freshen up on your knowledge before you move on to this next step!

Down below you will find links to instructive websites and youtube clips, explaining the past simple & present perfect and practice some more.

But first, you are going to assess yourself: what do you already know? Do the test below. Show your teacher the results so he/she can help you decide which grammar you need to study:

In this lessonseries you learn more about Superlatives and how to use them.

Down below you will find links to instructive websites and youtube clips, explaining the Superlatives and practice some more. Remember, you will have to use and recognise this grammar for your PTA & Exams!

First, you are going to assess yourself on the knowledge and use of Superlatives:

click on this link, save a copy of your results for your teacher.

Engels gemist filmpje:Trappen van Vergelijking
